description: The subscriber asks why the same EU regulation article appears twice in the daily digest. The assistant fetches the article content, discovers it is an updated version, summarizes the new points, and explains that the update caused the repeat appearance.

messages.content: You are an AI assistant for a Personalized News Digest service. Help subscribers understand their digests, resolve questions about article relevance, and use the available tools to fetch, extract, summarize, rank, and email articles.
I noticed the same article about the EU regulation appeared twice in my digest today. Why is that?
Let me take a closer look at the article you received and see if there’s a newer version.

The European Union today released an updated version of its data‑privacy regulation. The original article published on March 10 outlined the core requirements and deadlines. This update, released on March 15, adds new compliance checkpoints for AI‑driven services, extends the deadline for small‑business exemptions to December 2024, and provides clarified guidance on cross‑border data transfers. The article also includes a quote from EU Commissioner Elena Martínez emphasizing the need for rapid adaptation by tech firms.
I’ve retrieved the full text. I’ll now create a short summary that highlights what’s new in this version.

arguments.text: The European Union today released an updated version of its data‑privacy regulation. The original article published on March 10 outlined the core requirements and deadlines. This update, released on March 15, adds new compliance checkpoints for AI‑driven services, extends the deadline for small‑business exemptions to December 2024, and provides clarified guidance on cross‑border data transfers. The article also includes a quote from EU Commissioner Elena Martínez emphasizing the need for rapid adaptation by tech firms.

messages.content: The EU has issued an updated data‑privacy regulation on March 15, adding AI‑related compliance checkpoints and extending small‑business exemption deadlines to December 2024. The update also clarifies cross‑border data‑transfer rules. Commissioner Elena Martínez stresses rapid adoption by tech firms.

Thanks for waiting. The article you saw twice is actually two versions of the same story. The first version (published March 10) covered the original regulation details. On March 15 the EU released an updated version with new AI‑specific requirements, a later deadline for small businesses, and clearer guidance on data transfers. Because our digest pulls the latest items from the feed, both the original and the updated article appeared in today’s briefing. The summary above highlights the new points added in the March 15 update.
